hero.badge: Private Offline AI for Your Home
hero.title: SURSA — unter Ihrer Kontrolle
hero.lead: SURSA is a local AI companion designed to live in your home environment and run on hardware you control — supporting daily life without turning it into cloud data.
hero.p2: Plug it in, give it a name and a voice, and connect only what you choose: cameras, lights, appliances, calendars — or nothing at all. SURSA can pull official manuals to guide you clearly and safely.
hero.p3: At home, it acts as a calm family assistant and an extra layer of awareness. At work, it supports planning, procedures, and learning. The goal is not a bypass tool, but a practical helper that encourages lawful and constructive action.
hero.p4: Internet access is optional and deliberate: use it for manuals, official information, or updates — then return to offline mode. Clear control, predictable behavior, long-term usefulness.

about.title: Why SURSA Exists
about.imageAlt: SURSA device — private offline AI assistant for the home
about.p1: Most AI assistants today rely on remote infrastructure. While sometimes convenient, this often means personal routines and private details are processed outside your home.
about.p2: SURSA takes the opposite approach: its core runs locally on hardware you own. When you need something online — such as an official manual or support contact — it connects briefly on your command and then returns offline.
about.p3: The idea is simple: you talk to SURSA, and it helps your home function. Provide a device model or serial number — and receive practical, step-by-step guidance, from TVs and coffee makers to washing machines and garden systems.
about.p4: SURSA is built for real life: clear explanations, predictable routines, and concrete help — without endless menus and settings.
about.p5: For long-term continuity, SURSA relies on structured text context (no raw audio/video storage by default). This keeps the system lightweight and gives you direct control over what is kept or deleted.
about.p6: The system is designed with a teaching mindset: if a request veers toward risky or illegal directions, SURSA explains the consequences and suggests safer, legal alternatives.

mission.title: Our Mission
mission.p1: Artificial intelligence should serve people — not dominate daily life. SURSA is built around human control, clarity, and responsibility.
mission.problemText: Many AI systems rely on centralized cloud infrastructure and opaque data processing. This often creates incentives that prioritize scale and engagement over user control and transparency.
mission.alternativeText: SURSA is a local-first assistant: you own the hardware, define the rules, and decide when (or if) online access is used. The intent is practical help with clear boundaries.
mission.partnershipText: SURSA is conceived as collaboration: human intent combined with machine precision. The assistant should be predictable, accountable, and helpful — supporting decisions rather than replacing them.
mission.visionText: A future where AI belongs to people, not institutions: a simple household device — plug it in, connect what you choose, and keep intelligence private, local, and secure.

how.title: How It Works
how.item1Title: 1. Local brain with a continuous channel
how.item1Text: SURSA maintains a continuous local context instead of resetting every session. Preferences and rules persist over time, making the assistance more useful without constant re-learning.
how.item2Text: When a new device enters the home, SURSA can help you understand it. With online mode enabled, it retrieves official documentation and explains operation in plain language.
how.item3Title: 3. Rules and automations defined by you
how.item3Text: SURSA responds only to rules you define — lights on arrival, motion notifications, routine reminders, or “only act on explicit request”. It invents no behavior of its own.
how.item4Text: You choose language, voice, and tone. The interface is designed to be usable on mobile devices and assistive technologies, with multilingual support as a core goal.
how.item5Title: 5. Support for real work and daily life
how.item5Text: SURSA focuses on practical help: reminders, checklists, step-by-step procedures, planning, and learning support — using only the tools and access you explicitly allow.
how.item6Text: If a request moves toward risky or unlawful directions, SURSA explains the consequences and suggests safer alternatives. Long-term trust matters more than quick answers.

technicalLayers.title: Technical Layers
technicalLayers.trustAnchor: The coordination layer described below is a reserved research concept. It is not implemented, not active, and has no financial or commercial role.
technicalLayers.intro: Simplified architecture overview: offline-first, privacy by design, explicit opt-in for anything external.

localCore.title: Local Core (offline-first)
localCore.text: Core logic, memory management, and primary functions run locally on user-owned hardware to minimize exposure and external dependencies.

memory.title: Memory & Context
memory.text: Structured local context gives users control over what is stored, reviewed, or deleted. Raw audio/video data is not stored by default.

tools.title: Tools & Integrations (Opt-in)
tools.text: External services and integrations are optional and activated only on explicit user consent.

coordination.title: Coordination Layer (reserved research concept)
coordination.text: Reserved concept for future research on inter-device coordination. Not implemented, not active, and not part of the current behavior.

technicalLayers.note: SURSA is a research and development initiative. Privacy, transparency, and user control remain core principles.

roadmap.title: Research Roadmap
roadmap.item1Text: Stable local core with voice interaction and continuous context, actively tested in daily use.
roadmap.item2Text: Local sensors, cameras, and user-defined rules to understand the home state without default cloud reliance.
roadmap.item3Text: Dedicated device designed to run SURSA autonomously as a household unit.
roadmap.item4Text: Research devices deployed to selected families and contributors to validate real-world usage.
roadmap.item5Text: Exploration of controlled inter-device coordination for research purposes only. Not implemented in the current version.

team.title: Who Is Behind SURSA
team.p1: SURSA is developed by ETERNA TECHNOLOGY — an independent engineering company focused on privacy-respecting AI systems.
team.p2: The project grows from daily use of a working local core, with emphasis on reliability, transparency, and user control over data and behavior.
team.p3: Development is guided by long-term principles rather than short-term trends and is open to contributors who share the same values: privacy, autonomy, and responsible AI use.

faq.title: FAQ
faq.q1: Is SURSA a finished consumer product?
faq.a1: Not yet. The core is operational and used in real environments; dedicated hardware is in development.
faq.q2: Does SURSA require constant internet access?
faq.a2: No. Internet access is optional and user-controlled. The system functions offline.
faq.a3: Structured text context defined by the user. Raw audio/video data is not stored by default.
faq.q4: Can I control or delete the memory?
faq.a4: Yes. The memory is local and designed to be reviewable and removable under user control.
faq.a5: The user. Behavior, integrations, and access are explicitly defined by the hardware owner.
faq.q6: Is there pricing, public availability, or open signup?
faq.a6: Not at this stage. SURSA is an independent research initiative: no public sales, no public pricing, no open signup. Limited testing occurs internally or by invitation.

whoIsYourOn.heroSubtitle: SURSA is a private, offline-first AI assistant designed to live in your home environment, run on hardware you control, and support daily life with clear, user-defined boundaries.
whoIsYourOn.shortTextStrong: SURSA is your own local intelligence for home and everyday life
whoIsYourOn.shortTextSuffix: . It runs on your devices, communicates via voice and local connections, and stays under your direct control.
whoIsYourOn.whatIntro: SURSA is not just a gadget or an app. It is a system concept: local core, controlled memory model, optional integrations, and a long-term plan for a practical offline household device.
whoIsYourOn.whatItem1Text: The intelligence runs on user-owned hardware and processes requests locally by default. Long-term context is stored as structured text, without default cloud storage.
whoIsYourOn.whatItem2Text: SURSA listens, responds, and can support computer workflows and compatible local devices — reminders, planning, step-by-step guidance, and basic operational help.
whoIsYourOn.whatItem3Text: When a new device enters the home, SURSA can help you understand it. With online mode enabled, it retrieves official documentation and explains usage clearly and practically.
whoIsYourOn.whatItem4Text: SURSA can connect to cameras, sensors, and local automation systems — responding only according to your rules: lighting, notifications, presence checks, and simple safety routines.
whoIsYourOn.whatItem5Text: A dedicated device, similar to a Wi-Fi router, designed to run SURSA locally as a household intelligence hub — without default cloud reliance.
whoIsYourOn.whatItem6Text: Reserved concept for future research on inter-device coordination. Not implemented, not active, and has no financial or commercial role in the current system.
whoIsYourOn.notIntro: To avoid confusion, here is what SURSA does not aim to be:
whoIsYourOn.notItem1: SURSA is not a cloud service that continuously streams your private life to remote servers.
whoIsYourOn.notItem2: SURSA is not a tool for illegal actions, hacking, or bypassing security systems.
whoIsYourOn.notItem3: SURSA is not a speculative hype product.
whoIsYourOn.notItem4: SURSA does not replace certified medical, legal, or professional advice.
whoIsYourOn.principle1Text: The main intelligence operates inside your home network. Online access is optional and explicitly controlled by you.
whoIsYourOn.principle2Text: SURSA remains useful even with unstable or no internet, as core behavior and context are local.
whoIsYourOn.principle3Text: Long-term hardware plans include a physical on/off switch. Switched off = no processing and no network activity.
whoIsYourOn.principle4Text: SURSA supports real work and daily decisions, guiding toward lawful, safe, and constructive actions.
whoIsYourOn.principle5Text: System behavior is defined by your permissions and rules. No hidden access, no silent data export, no forced online dependence.
whoIsYourOn.archIntro: SURSA uses a layered model that separates local intelligence, home devices, and optional external access:
whoIsYourOn.archStep1Text: Reasoning engine running on user-owned hardware with voice interaction, system tools, and local context storage.
whoIsYourOn.archStep2Text: Cameras, sensors, and automation devices inside the local network, without mandatory external relays.
whoIsYourOn.archStep3Text: Used only when explicitly needed — manuals, official information, current data, or remote access (if enabled).
whoIsYourOn.forWhomItem1: Families who want an assistant without constant data leakage to the cloud.
whoIsYourOn.forWhomItem2: Users who prioritize privacy, autonomy, and local control.
whoIsYourOn.forWhomItem3: Busy people who rely on routines, reminders, and clear planning.
whoIsYourOn.forWhomItem4: Professionals who need a practical assistant, not a toy.
whoIsYourOn.forWhomItem5: Elderly relatives who benefit from gentle, family-configured support.
whoIsYourOn.companyP1: SURSA is developed by ETERNA ENGINEERING S.R.L. — an independent engineering company focused on practical, privacy-respecting AI systems for real homes.
whoIsYourOn.companyP2: The company plans to expand engineering and research teams and collaborate with contributors who share values of autonomy, transparency, and responsible AI use.
whoIsYourOn.quickQ1Title: Is SURSA a finished consumer device?
whoIsYourOn.quickQ1Text: Not yet. The core already runs locally on real hardware and is actively tested. Dedicated hardware prototypes are in development.
whoIsYourOn.quickQ2Title: Does SURSA require constant internet access?
whoIsYourOn.quickQ2Text: No. Internet access is optional and used only for explicitly requested tasks.
whoIsYourOn.quickQ3Title: Does SURSA store raw audio or video?
whoIsYourOn.quickQ3Text: Not by default. The system is built around structured text context. Any media handling would be explicit and opt-in.
whoIsYourOn.quickQ4Title: What is the main idea behind SURSA?
whoIsYourOn.quickQ4Text: A personal AI that acts like a long-term partner — helping you become more capable, not more dependent.

pressCenter.heroSubtitle: This page contains verified project information: progress updates, roadmap milestones, and practical notes on privacy and responsible use. SURSA is developed as an offline-first system designed to remain under direct user control.
pressCenter.news1Title: Local Core Running in Daily Testing
pressCenter.news1Text: The current SURSA core operates locally on user-owned hardware and is used in day-to-day workflows. Focus is on stability: continuous context, predictable behavior, and practical assistance without default cloud dependence. Online access remains optional and user-controlled.
pressCenter.news2Title: Privacy-First Approach: Structured Context, Explicit Consent
pressCenter.news2Text: SURSA is designed to store structured text context rather than raw audio/video by default. External integrations are opt-in and require explicit activation. The system promotes lawful, constructive use and discourages risky or illegal behavior.
pressCenter.releasesItem1Text: Release notes will appear here as stable milestones are reached (local core, home awareness modules, hardware prototype iterations). Each release will describe changes, what is verifiably working, and what remains experimental.
pressCenter.releasesItem2Text: Updates published here aim to be verifiable in real use: offline operation, local memory behavior, opt-in online mode, and clear boundaries around safety and data control. This press page prioritizes accuracy over hype.
pressCenter.archiveText: Older updates are archived to preserve long-term continuity. The goal is honest documentation of progress: what was built, what was tested, and which principles remained unchanged.
pressCenter.archive2025Text: Foundation year: defining offline-first principles, building a working local core, and shaping the architecture for memory, tools, and home awareness.
pressCenter.archiveFutureText: Hardware prototype revisions, milestone releases, and safety advisories will be added as the project evolves. Major changes will be documented with clear scope and rationale.

forJournalists.heroIntro: This page is a compact reference for media and researchers: what SURSA is, how to describe it accurately, key facts, and answers to common questions. We focus on verifiable claims and privacy-first principles.
forJournalists.howSentenceText: SURSA is a private offline-first AI assistant that runs on user-owned hardware, stores long-term context as structured text, and supports home and daily work with explicit user control over any online access.
forJournalists.howShortText: SURSA is an offline-first AI assistant designed to live inside the home environment. It runs on hardware controlled by the user, stores long-term context as structured text, and can access the internet only when the user requests it (for manuals, official instructions, and updates). The system is built for practical daily use, predictable behavior, and responsible, lawful assistance.
forJournalists.factsItem1: Offline-first: core logic and memory are local by design.
forJournalists.factsItem2: Memory model: structured text context (no raw audio/video stored by default).
forJournalists.factsItem3: Online access: opt-in, deliberate, and limited to explicit user requests.
forJournalists.factsItem4: Safety stance: the system discourages illegal or risky actions and suggests lawful alternatives.
forJournalists.factsItem5: Status: research & development initiative; no consumer device release date announced here.
forJournalists.qa1Question: Is SURSA a finished consumer product?
forJournalists.qa1Answer: Not yet. The local core is operational and used in practical testing. Dedicated hardware prototypes are in development.
forJournalists.qa2Question: Does SURSA require constant internet access?
forJournalists.qa2Answer: No. The system is designed to work offline. Online mode is optional and triggered only for explicitly requested tasks.
forJournalists.qa3Answer: By default, structured text context defined by the user. Raw audio/video storage is not part of the base design and would be opt-in if ever introduced.
forJournalists.contactText: For verified information, clarifications, or interview requests, contact the SURSA team through official project channels. We are happy to provide short descriptions, key facts, and technical wording review before publication.
